com.HealthBytes.executable

Class Quiz

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • com.HealthBytes.executable.MenuParent
              • com.HealthBytes.executable.Quiz
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class Quiz
extends MenuParent
    The creates a quiz panel with working buttons and questions. Will not allow user to proceed if their score is less than 75%.

    Course Info:

    ICS4U0 - Krasteva, V.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    (Project Manager) Russell Leong, (Project Member) Liam Telenko
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Quiz

        public Quiz(Game gme,
            int l)
        The Quiz constructor correctly lays out a new JPanel (super call to MenuParent) and proceeds to fill it with a question label and answer buttons.
        Parameters:
        gme - The game object being passed into the constructor.
        l - The level number which created the new Quiz object.

    • Method Detail

      • fillQuestions

        public void fillQuestions(java.lang.String levelName)
        fillQuestions inputs data from a file specifically for each quiz, parses it, and then adds the parsed data correctly to an ArrayList for use in the Quiz object.
        Parameters:
        levelName - The String representation of the level number.

      • createButtons

        public javax.swing.JPanel createButtons()
        createButtons method and adds the answer buttons to the JPanel centered on the screen.
        Returns:
        JPanel complete with all styled and triggerable answer buttons.

      • setButton

        public void setButton(javax.swing.JButton button)
        setButton sets the correct size for the buttons and modifies their appearance. This method keeps consistency between the buttons of the program.
        Overrides:
        setButton in class MenuParent
        Parameters:
        button - The button which is to be styled and attached to an action listener.

      • changeQuestion

        public void changeQuestion(int number)
        changeQuestion updates the questionLabel and the buttons in buttonContainer.
        Parameters:
        number - The number to update the question to.

      • endQuiz

        public void endQuiz()
        endQuiz calculates the final score and displays it to the user. It also controls where the user can proceed to next.

      • buttonClicked

        public void buttonClicked(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
        buttonClicked checks which button has been clicked and responds appropriately. The method controls the flow of the quiz.
        Specified by:
        buttonClicked in class MenuParent
        Parameters:
        e - Checks if an ActionEvent is made on the button.
